title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
Job Overview:  

We are currently seeking a versatile and detail-oriented Quality Assurance Engineer that will be responsible for creating and executing end-to-end test cases for new and existing features for our educator facing products in an agile/scrum and kanban environment. This person will collaborate with engineers, product managers and stakeholders around new features, enhancements, code changes and their impact on stability, reliability, and customer satisfaction. This candidate will be able to create test cases from requirement documents, user stories, and customer scenarios and present them to the team for review. This position requires the ability to track progress across different releases and environments via JIRA and communicate issues and status out to the team. This candidate will be working with other QA resources and automation engineers in a continuous QA process and take ownership of the products quality and stability for each release.  

This position is for someone willing to ask Why and How from a customer and quality standpoint.  

* Why are implementing this feature?
* How is this helping the end user or internal teams?
* How does this work end to end?

  

Job Responsibilities:  

* Create, Execute, and maintain test cases for new feature, regression, and smoke test cycles
* Test the product from a customer perspective
* Transform customer scenarios that replicate real-world product usage into test cases
* Perform root cause analysis and implement corrective action processes
* Work in a team-oriented environment with other QA engineers, developers, customer support, educational curriculum, creative, and research experts
* Use JIRA for all ticket types and track progress
* Prioritize multiple, simultaneous assignments from within and outside of the QA group, including off-shore QA team members
* Ability to understand and troubleshoot API json requests and responses
* Ability to query databases to verify and validate product data
* Understanding of browser debugging and console tools

  

Job Requirements:  

* BS in Computer Science or related field experience
* 2+ years of software quality assurance experience
* 1+ years of Database experience (SQL Server, MySQL)
* Experience with test management systems, specifically Zephyr
* Experience with JIRA to create and track issues within multiple products
* Self-motivated and takes pride in their work, strong follow-up skills
* Passion for finding inefficiencies and the desire to constantly improve
* Excellent English oral and written communication skills


To learn more about our organization and the exciting work we do, visit https://www.lexialearning.com/
An Equal Opportunity Employer*We are dedicated to fostering a culture that celebrates unique backgrounds, ideas, and experiences. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of race, color, age, religion, sex, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.*

title: Quality Assurance Engineer - Lead (Remote)
description:
**Company Description**  

pureIntegration is a technology consulting firm with 20 years of experience servicing Fortune 100 clients headquartered in the DC area. We serve clients in the fastest growing industry of communications, media, and entertainment.

 **Job Description**  

We are looking for a **Quality Assurance Engineer - Lead**to join our team. In this role, you will supporting applications, systems, and changes to existing software or launches of new software that meet business and organizational needs. The engineer must also be comfortable looking at the source code for the services being tested to understand API usage or failure points and collaborate with senior developers to understand the services being tested.


The ideal candidate should have experience supporting the implementation of scalable, microservices solutions, including familiarity or ability to gain familiarity with various industry standards and specifications related to video advertising, content standards, and classifications.

**This position is a remote (in the U.S.) position and will be full-time.**  

  

The annual base salary is *$100,000 –$ 120,000****.*** Candidates will be paid within this range based on their work experience and skills. Candidates are also eligible for our full list of benefits linked here.

***Responsibilities:***

* Collaborate with Development and DevOps to build a test bed and generate test data supporting Audio/video ingest, workflows, and system configurations.
* Provide technical expertise and recommendations in assessing new software projects and initiatives to support, enhance, and improve the efficiency of business processes.
* Serve as a liaison and facilitator between business units to assist in addressing and resolving issues (in collaboration with development and deployment teams and resources).
* Provide recommendations to help drive process improvements for quality engineering focusing on automation and regressions.
* Own deliverables such as, but not limited to, issues and risks logs, test strategy, test plan, scripts, automation maturity process, and communications (written and verbal) to stakeholders, including senior management and executives.
* Assist in user acceptance testing, documentation, and training for effective use of applications and technology.
* Help analyze and improve existing AWS cloud architecture, design, and delivery.
* Work collaboratively with internal and external partners on current production system defects, changes, or upgrades to resolve problems and improve processes or systems.
* Investigate and resolve application and system functionality-related issues and aid with troubleshooting. Going the extra mile to hone into the root cause.
* Define, prioritize, and execute testing scope for end-to-end functional, non-functional, regression, integration, performance, regression, smoke testing.
* Promote the improvement of CI/CD automation and efficiency through code/scripts and process rigor.
* Manage software (SaaS) packaging and deployment.
* Drive on & offshore coordination of all QA/QE efforts as the lead of QA efforts.
* Assist in Production Operations Maintenance issues and customer service support activities.

  

**Qualifications**  

* 8+ years of quality engineering/assurance / hands-on testing.
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science/Engineering with software development and deployment experience.
* Experience with advertising and asset management platforms would be a plus.
* Prior Quality Engineering experience (helping manage multiple integrated deployment environments).
* Experience functioning through CI/CD pipelines and validating multiple deployment branches, while utilizing QA management toolsets and establishing best practices.
* Experience with software testing automation, including Continuous/ Integration/Continuous/Deployment/Delivery, DevOps, API/services, and database-level validation automation.
* Microservice, AWS, cloud engineering & architecture experience.
* Familiarity with various Software development methodologies such as SAFE/Agile.
* Self-starter and motivated team member, strong communications, analytical, and process skills set.

  

**Additional Information** *pureIntegration is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE), qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.*

pureIntegration provides reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in job application procedures. For reasonable accommodation requests, please contact us by email at hr@pureintegration.com or by mail to: pureIntegration, Human Resources Department, 1801 Robert Fulton Dr, Suite 450, Reston, VA 20191. Please indicate the position you are applying for.

title: Sr. Quality Engineer
description:
**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for all aspects of testing and Quality Engineering through the full project/sprint lifecycle (from conception through implementation) under the direction of the Manager – Quality Engineering
* **Automate Manual regression testing suites. Build the automation framework where necessary and tweak the existing scripts/framework as per the application changes**
* Own manual test script development and execution, data sourcing/data provisioning, defect analysis, and ensuring that proper test result documentation and processes are followed as per the test strategy
* Understand full end-to-end business processes and transaction flows across systems for the specific areas that you are responsible for
* Daily & Weekly test execution reports for the project(s) in-flight.
* Facilitate User Acceptance Testing by providing data in the necessary lower environments for the UAT testers/ users. Serve as testing SME to guide business in the technical areas of user acceptance testing environment.
* Partner with the Business/Systems Analysts’/Product Managers, Application Developers and operational end-users to ensure that test scripts are developed and/or modified to cover new functionality and/or enhancements that are introduced into the production system on an ongoing basis.
* Analyze defects identified in production system to ensure that the proper controls are implemented in the regression test bed to ensure that the defect does not occur in production again
* Perform initial analysis of defects identified during the testing cycle and escalate issues as required to the functional support teams for resolution. Ensure that the defects are logged in JIRA, updated from time to time until closure.
* Apply subject matter expertise to identify, develop, and implement techniques to improve product and process quality
* Leverage automation of regression test scripts in order to reduce the amount of time and resources required to execute the regression test bed
* Maintain full traceability between requirements and test cases in JIRA/Other tools
* Provide accurate estimates and timely status updates
* Prepare and maintain KT documentation for onboarding new team members and update the documentation from time to time
* Work closely with offshore testing team responsible for executing tests
* Write SQL queries or appropriate assertion routines to validate software functions as needed
* Communicate clearly with your peers on product and solution teams to both understand their product and technology requirements while also representing your own
* Ability to generate reports from JIRA & other Test Management tools

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

* Experience in Order Management and/or Sourcing technology transformation initiatives from inception to implementation is highly desirable
* Web Services testing experience using Rest APIs
* Experience with CICD build automation tools is required
* Experience integrating with Test Management tools like JIRA is desirable
* Collaborate with engineers/developers and other Stakeholders to deliver a quality Sourcing application being built in multiple phase**s**
* Experience working with vendor partners, implementation partners and other quality engineering teams.
* Document QE processes and procedures
* Create test artifacts and test plans
* Develop and execute test cases, scripts, plans and procedures (manual and automated)
* Trace test cases and results back to specific requirements/stories/quality risks
* Communicate clearly with your peers on product and solution teams to both understand their product and technology requirements while also representing your own

**Experience Required:**

* Retail experience is a MUST with ***Subject Matter Expertise in Blue Yonder’s IA & Sourcing products .***
* ***Hands-on testing experience with Blue Yonder is a MUST***
* AS/400 experience and expertise in AS/400 hands-on testing is highly desirable.
* **Webservices testing experience is a MUST**
* Database testing & querying experience is required
* Good analytical skills are required
* **Experience with building automation frameworks and automation Test Scripts using Selenium, Java and REST assured tool is a MUST**
* **Executing existing Automation regression test suites and updating them based on change requests is required.**
* **Ability to manage multiple tasks on a given project and multiple projects at a given point of time**
* Expertise in QA processes and ability to provide direction/guidance to other QA team members
* Experience with BDD/TDD (Cucumber/Gherkin) is preferred
* **Overall experience of 8+ years in Quality Engineering & Analysis with a combination of automation skills, Blue Yonder and Order Management hands on testing experience is a MUST**
* Good understanding of software QE concepts, recommended practices, and methodology that cover functional testing, integration testing, regression testing, End to End testing and UAT
* **Ability to manage multiple enterprise level initiatives in different SDLC & STLC phases**
* **Demonstrated experience working with offshore resources**
* **Flexibility to work with offshore teams during core overlapping hours is required.**
* **Strong understanding of Agile and traditional SDLC & STLC**
* **Experience designing test strategies and end-to-end test scenarios and estimating test efforts**
* **Experience working with JIRA is a MUST**
* Must be results oriented, and demonstrate a “can do” attitude, adaptability, flexibility and resourcefulness
* Good writing and speaking skills are required
* Good understanding of various testing types is required
* Must be able to work within a team and independently without any supervision at times
* Degreed professional (Computer Science, Information Technology or related degree) required or equivalent experience.

Preferred Visa Types - Green Card, Citizenship & EAD

Pay: $30.00 - $55.00 per hour

Experience level:

* 8 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

title: QA Engineer
description:
**The Company**  

Cover Genius is a Series D insurtech that protects the global customers of the world’s largest digital companies including Booking Holdings, owner of Priceline, Kayak and Booking.com, Intuit, Uber, Hopper, Ryanair, Turkish Airlines, Descartes ShipRush, Zip and SeatGeek. We’re also available at Amazon, Flipkart, eBay, Wayfair and SE Asia’s largest company, Shopee. Our partners integrate with XCover, our award-winning insurance distribution platform, to embed protection for millions of customers worldwide each year.

Our team and products have been recognized with dozens of awards including by the Financial Times which ranked Cover Genius as the #1 fastest-growing company in APAC in 2020. Our diverse team across 20+ countries and many language groups commit itself to diverse cultural programs, in particular “CG Gives” which makes social entrepreneurs out of us all and funds development initiatives in global communities. **Our People are**
Bold, Authentic, Purposeful and Inspired **Our People are not**
Perfect, Traditional, Complacent or Cautious **About the Role**  

A QA Engineer at Cover Genius is the foremost advocate of the culture of quality. Their primary responsibility is to promote a working environment where employees follow quality guidelines and consistently see others taking quality-focused actions, hear others talking about quality, and feel quality all around them.  

As a QA Engineer in Cover Genius, you will be tasked with developing test frameworks - working closely with engineers to help implement best testing practices, ensuring our QA processes are robust and scalable.
A key team member integral to the product and service the technical teams deliver.
### **What will your day look like? You will...**

* Understand and reinforce the business value of the requirements of the company and project core goals of the products and services we offer
* Review requirements, specifications, and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
* Create both API and UI automated test scripts Identify, record, document thoroughly, and track bugs
* Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved
* Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to meet the company's objectives
* Liaise with internal teams (e.g. developers and product managers) to identify system requirements
* Monitor debugging process results
* Investigate the causes of non-conforming software and train users to implement solutions
* Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies

### **To help us level up, you'll ideally have:**

* 4 years or more of full-time experience working as a QA or Test Engineer
* Solid experience in Web or API automation testing - any programming language - and manual Web testing
* Bonus points if you have experience in testing REST APIs
* Must have good Web automation knowledge/experience using Selenium or Cypressor experience in general automation using any programming language - bonus points if you have coding experience with Python, JavaScript or PHP
* Must have a decent understanding of HTTP protocol and client-server architecture
* General solid troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
* Great requirement analysis and gap analysis skills
* It is nice to have basic knowledge of SQL, Bash, Git and GitLab
* Interest in working in a dynamic and “tech-first mindset” environment
* Experience in exploratory testing is welcome
* Comfortable with agile development such as Scrum or Kanban
* Interest in learning or deepening technical/automation skills

### **To be successful, you'll bring:**

* Excellent communication skills
* Passion for Quality Assurance
* Eager to assume the responsibility for QA processes
* Excellent attention to details
* Ability to work under pressure
* Organizational and time management skills
* Embrace changes that lead to continuous improvement

**Why Cover Genius?**  

Cover Genius not only cares about being the best in our industry, we care about our team. We’re a business that understands life can be fluid and so we flex to ensure we provide the environment to suit that. What does that mean?* Flexible PTO. Taking time out is important for our teams to enjoy life and stay fresh.
* Employee Stock Options - we want our people to share in our success, we reward them with ownership for their contribution in creating a world-class company.
* Work with like-minded people who are passionate about both the work we're doing and giving back. Our CG Gives programs enables us to all become philanthropists through our peer recognition and rewards system.
* Social Initiatives - pictures speak a thousand words!

 **Salary Range**  

The base salary range for this role is between $72,000 and $99,000. The total compensation package also includes equity, and the opportunity for additional earnings through our annual bonus or variable commission plans.  

We believe in transparency, and this salary range bracket is designed to provide a clear understanding of the potential earnings associated with this role. Your skills and contributions are highly valued, and we look forward to welcoming you to our team.  

Sound interesting? If you think you have the best composition of the above, send us your resume and let's chat!* *Cover Genius promotes diversity and inclusivity. We don't tolerate discrimination, demeaning treatment of anyone, or harassment due to race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.*

title: Data QA Engineer
description:
### **What You'll Do:**



As a Data QA Engineer, you will help promote space safety, security, and sustainability by ensuring the quality of the data products generated by the Slingshot Global Sensor Network (SGSN). You will perform data curation and support efforts to monitor and visualize data quality and related metrics pertaining to SGSN data collection, processing, exploitation, and dissemination. You'll work with the SGSN Operations Team, as well as interact with product managers, software developers, and other internal stakeholders to gather and execute against data product requirements in a timely manner.


### **Position Responsibilities:**


* Executes all position responsibilities in alignment with Slingshot's core values, mission, and purpose
* Design, develop, and maintain data quality and related metrics, alerts, and visualizations thereof
* Analyze data in near real-time to identify issues for other teammates to investigate, and support the resolution and reporting thereof
* Regularly review data quality metrics and make improvements as customer needs and product capabilities evolve
* Troubleshoot data quality issues and modify test procedures to facilitate customer success
* Follow & promote industry best practices for data quality assurance and tool sets
* Perform other duties as assigned (to be less than 10% of the responsibilities listed above)


**Pre-Requisites**


* Must be a U.S. citizen eligible for government clearances

### **Minimum Requirements**


* 2+ years of QA methodologies, automated testing tools and test strategies
* Knowledge and passion for data curation and data QA methodologies & processes, including designing automated testing solutions
* Expertise in breaking down feature requirements to design efficient targeted & end-to-end testing scenarios
* Excellent communication skills and ability to interact with all levels of end users and technical resources
* Meticulous attention to detail
* Skill and comfort working on a fast-paced team with dynamic objectives and iteration with users


**Preferred Skills**


* Previous experience taking ownership of data curation activities
* Experience with Python, MongoDB, Datadog
* Experience working in a startup environment on a high-performing team


* These skills are guidelines, not hard and fast rules. You don't have to meet every qualification listed- if your skills are transferable and you meet the minimum requirements, we encourage you to apply.


**Location:** Remote Continental US


**Pay Range:** $75,000-$95,000


**Classification:** Full time Exempt (computer employee exemption)



Equity, Diversity & Inclusion are key to our success. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and our employees are people with different strengths, experiences and backgrounds, who share a passion for creating a safer, more connected world. Diversity not only includes race and gender identity, but also age, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, religion and many other parts of one's identity. All of our employee's points of view are key to our success, and we embrace individuality.

title: Lead, Quality Assurance-Remote
description:
**Lumicera Health Services Powered by Navitus**

**Innovative Specialty Pharmacy Solutions-** *Lumicera Health Services is defining the “new norm” in specialty pharmacy to optimize patient well-being* through our core principles of transparency and stewardship. Here at Lumicera, our team members work in an environment that celebrates creativity and fosters diversity.


Due to growth, we are adding this Lead, Quality Assurance to our IT Department


We are unable to offer remote work to residents of Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, New Hampshire, New Mexico, North Dakota, Rhode Island, South Carolina, South Dakota, West Virginia, and Wyoming.


The QA Lead will play a crucial role in the successful implementation of several software projects and help develop a QA strategy applicable to all users/applications. Reporting to the Director of I.T, this individual will lead a team of QAs and function as a player/coach to drive the QA strategy for Lumicera.


The QA Lead is a pivotal role in our large- scale IT modernization project, focusing on the effective planning, coordination, and execution of comprehensive testing strategies. This position demands a highly skilled individual with exceptional experience in Azure DevOps, AWS or other cloud platforms and a proven track record in developing advanced testing frameworks using modernized tools.


Is this you? Find out more below!

**How do I make an impact on my team?**

* Develop and implement a robust testing strategy encompassing all aspects of the modernization project.
* Participate in teams to develop comprehensive test strategies, plans, impact analysis, specifications, and test cases for effective assurance and testing functions.
* Author test cases/scripts and execution plans for both project and support-related activities.
* Design and implement automated test plans to streamline testing processes.
* Provide oversight to ensure automation test suites are well-maintained and operational.
* Utilize tools like Azure DevOps for test automation, ensuring alignment with project objectives and timelines.
* Plan and execute performance and stress tests to evaluate system stability and scalability.
* Analyze test results and provide insights for system enhancements and optimizations.
* Provide accurate estimates for QA efforts including test case design/scripting, test execution, and defect correction.

* 5+ years of experience with test case management and test case management tools

* 5+ years of experience with defect management and using defect management tools like JIRA.
* 5+ years of experience managing test environments.
* 5+ years of experience with defect management and using defect management tools like JIRA.
* 5+ years of experience managing test environments
* Participate in, adhere to, and support compliance program objectives

title: Senior Quality Assurance
description:
**Position Overview:**  
As a Senior Quality Assurance Engineer, you will play a key role in ensuring the reliability, performance, and usability of our software applications. You will be responsible for designing and implementing robust testing strategies, conducting thorough evaluations of software functionality, and identifying areas for improvement to enhance the overall user experience.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and execute comprehensive test plans, test cases, and test scripts to validate software functionality, performance, and reliability.
* Design and implement automated testing frameworks to streamline the testing process and improve efficiency.
* Collaborate with software developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to identify requirements, define acceptance criteria, and ensure alignment with quality standards.
* Conduct thorough regression testing to validate software updates, patches, and new feature releases.
* Analyze test results, identify defects, and work closely with development teams to troubleshoot issues and implement timely resolutions.
* Mentor junior QA team members, providing guidance and support to foster their professional growth and development.
* Stay current with industry best practices, emerging technologies, and trends in quality assurance and software testing.

**Qualifications:**

* Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field is desirable.
* years of experience in software quality assurance, with a proven track record of success in a senior or leadership role.
* Strong proficiency in software testing methodologies, tools, and techniques.
* Experience with test automation frameworks and tools (e.g., Selenium, Appium, JUnit).
* Proficient in programming languages such as Java, Python, or JavaScript.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
* Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, Agile environment.

This role is either on-site, hybrid, or fully remote (globally based) and is dependent on experience so salary will vary and is upon application.

Salary: From $22,000.00 per year

Experience level:

* 1 year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* No weekends

title: QA Engineer
description:
**We are seeking a QA Engineer with 2+ years of commercial experience in manual and automated testing of web applications. The engineer will collaborate with cross-functional teams and play a crucial role in ensuring the quality of our products, solutions and services.**  



**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Develop comprehensive test plans, checklists and test procedures.
* Conduct UI, functional (blackbox, API), and performance testing for web apps.
* Undertake exploratory testing as needed.
* Identify and report issues.
* Develop and maintain automated tests.
* Provide test reports on a regular basis.
* Propose solutions for preventing issues.
* Provide estimates for testing/QA efforts as required.
* Actively engage in scrum ceremonies and contribute value.
* Communicate with clients and end-users to accurately comprehend business requirements and translate them into efficient test strategies.
* Persistently enhance your technical skills to keep up with QA best practices.
* Share your knowledge and experience with team members and colleagues.
**Requirements**
----------------

**Essential Skills**
--------------------

* At least 2 years of professional experience in manual testing of web applications.
* Practical experience working in Agile teams (Scrum, Kanban, etc).
* Natural attention to detail.
* Strong theoretical background in QA
* Excellent logical thinking and analytical skills.
* Experience in creating and maintaining test documentation.
* Proficiency in test automation with Selenium (Python or JS) or Cypress.
* Familiarity with version control systems (e.g. Git, TFS, Mercurial, SVN).
* Experience in integrating tests with CI/CD processes.
* Skills in API testing (Postman; REST, GraphQL).
* English proficiency at B2 level or higher.
* Capability to work independently with minimal supervision.
* Ability to make decisions in ambiguous situations.
* Effective verbal and written communication skills.
* Passion for continuous learning.
**Preferred Skills**
--------------------

* ISTQB certificate.
**Location and Team Collaboration**
-----------------------------------


This is a part-time remote position (from 4h/day), with the possibility to transition to full-time depending on mutual agreement and business needs. You can work from your preferred location with occasional on-site collaboration at various offices, including Budva, Philadelphia, etc. Working hours are flexible but should overlap with our core locations in ET, CET, EET time zones.**About Speed & Function**
--------------------------


At Speed & Function, we build exceptional custom software applications using today’s most advanced technology. But so do a lot of software engineering firms, so what makes working for us different? Firstly, we operate out of two continents. Most of our engineers are based in Eastern Europe, and our US Head Office is in Philadelphia.  

Second, everyone who works here is passionate about digital transformation, innovation and collaborative software development. However, don’t confuse us with contractors, because we’re not. We are true collaborators. We work so closely with clients that their products are virtually built in-house. This gives our people the opportunity to work with clients in a unique way. Think Collaboration 2.0.  

Third, we are striving to build a developmental culture where learning, feedback and transparency are given equal weight to productivity, efficiency and results. At Speed & Function, you’re given the chance to grow, not just technically but as a person. We aim to become better people who produce brilliant work and offer our clients a fulfilling and enjoyable experience along the way.

description:

Are you excited about a career in SaaS that has a direct effect on the hospitality industry? This might be the perfect opportunity for you!

**In this role you will:**


A Quality Assurance Engineer at Actabl conducts and performs standardized testing designed to find flaws before they become larger issues. Assists in troubleshooting processes and verifies that implemented fixes have intended results. Creates logs and tracking systems to document testing results.

**Typical Functions:**

* Develops and maintains test case scenarios including automated and regression testing.
* Provides reports containing results of testing procedures.
* Updates and maintains documentation regarding quality assurance testing policies and procedures.


Requirements:
* Strong written and verbal communication, with the ability to translate ideas and questions between end users and engineers.

* Team contribution skills and a desire to teach others.
* Organization skills and proven reliability: ability to work independently with little direction when necessary.

**Employees at Actabl are eligible for the following benefits:**

title: Quality Assurance Specialist
description:
At First Advantage, people are at the heart of everything we do. This mindset spans from our customers and partners, to our greatest strength: our team members. Join us if you want to say “hello” to a rewarding career, and pave the way as an industry leader in mission-critical background screening solutions to some of the most recognized Fortune 100 and Global 500 brands.

**Who We Are**


We are on the frontline of the Great Onboarding, empowering organizations to Hire Smarter. Onboard Faster™. First Advantage (Nasdaq: FA) is an HR Tech company that delivers innovative solutions and insights to enable our clients to manage risk and hire the best talent. Leveraging an advanced global technology platform, First Advantage builds fully scalable, configurable screening programs that meet the unique needs of over 33,000 clients across the world. Headquartered in Atlanta, GA and with a globally distributed workforce spanning 28 locations with 5,500+ employees, First Advantage performs over 93 million screens in over 200 countries and territories annually.

**Who You Are**


We are looking for a team member who considers themselves:

* **Self-motivated** – you love to lead others but are also ready to “roll up your sleeves." You can spearhead a project and see it through from start to completion.
* **A team player** – you navigate cross-functional teams and work well with team members across groups toward a common goal. While you are an independent contributor, you appreciate the value in collaboration.
* **An innovator** – you see gaps in current processes or workflows as an opportunity to improve and try something new.
* **A lifelong learner** – you seek opportunities to learn and upskill, you understand the importance of thorough and secure screenings, and are interested in the Human Capital sector and the confluence of people, process, and technology.

**What You'll Do**


As a **Quality Assurance Specialist**, you will carry out QA testing across the project's lifecycle, simulating end-user interactions with our products and communicating any found defects back to the development team. The candidate will be expected to work meticulously to test, detect, and report any problems with our software programs, apps, and websites. We are seeking an individual with at least 2 years of experience in the field, a bachelor's degree in computer science or a related area, or equivalent experience with a strong understanding of QA practices and the software development lifecycle (SDLC).

* Conduct thorough QA testing for software programs, apps, and websites, including running test cases to validate product functionality.
* Identify, document, and write detailed bug tickets for any discovered issues, ensuring clear communication with the development team.
* Perform regression testing on applications to verify fixed bugs and maintain product integrity after updates.
* Utilize Selenium for creating automated tests to streamline the testing process.
* Assess the functionality and overall user experience of our products, focusing on precision and attention to detail.
* Record and report any issues to the development team, providing detailed accounts to assist in the troubleshooting process.

**What You May Need to Be Successful:**

* Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field, or equivalent experience and skills.
* Minimum 2 years of experience in software development and quality assurance.
* Working knowledge of various programming languages, development platforms, and Selenium for test automation.
* Strong writing skills for clear and effective bug reporting and documentation.
* Ability to collaborate effectively with others and work as part of a team.
* In-depth knowledge of QA best practices and a thorough understanding of the SDLC.
* Exceptional attention to detail to identify even the most subtle of issues.
* Proven communication, reporting, and troubleshooting skills to aid in the swift resolution of problems.


This is a fully remote position (Work from Home) based in the US.

**Why First Advantage is Your Next Big Career Move**


First Advantage is going through a technology transformation! We are looking for experts who are excited to work with advanced technologies and provide best-in-class user experiences, drive the development and deployment of scalable solutions, and smoothly guide our agile teams and clients through meaningful changes as we continue to expand our impact.

**Additional benefits offered to our eligible people include:**

* Ability to work remotely with occasional business travel
* Medical, Vision, Dental, and supplementary benefit plans
* 401k with an employer match, and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
* Competitive and flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) and 8 paid company holidays
* Access to tech and growth opportunities, and leaders who want you to succeed!

**More About Our Values Code**

* Honor Honesty, Consistency, Responsibility: Do the right thing
* Cultivate an environment of dignity: Show respect for the individual
* Take an Outside-In approach: Put the client first
* Think out-of-the-box: Innovate and create
* Stay Team-Oriented: Collaborate and appreciate each other

**What Are You Waiting For? Apply Today!**


You have learned a little about us today – we want to learn about you! If you think this position and our company are a great fit for your areas of interest and expertise, tell us about you by applying now!


United States Equal Opportunity Employment:


First Advantage is proud to be a global leader in removing barriers and supporting our community members to ensure the changing demographics of the workforce are reflected in our hiring and employment practices. We value all of our candidates, employees, and clients, and place great emphasis on hiring and supporting qualified individuals in each role. We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other area protected by applicable law.

* Perform regression testing to ensure that introduced changes do not affect existing functionality.
* Develop, maintain, and enhance automation frameworks.
* Integrate automated tests into the CI/CD pipeline to enable continuous feedback.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, product managers, and other stakeholders, to ensure alignment in understanding requirements and quality metrics.
* Provide timely feedback to the development team regarding usability, functionality, and quality.
* Advocate for quality assurance best practices throughout the software development life cycle.
* Stay current with the latest testing tools, trends, and methodologies and share knowledge with the team.
* Generate detailed defect and test execution reports.
* Present quality metrics and findings to stakeholders and leadership.

**Education & Experience:**

* 5+ years of experience in software quality assurance required
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field preferred
* Expert technical skills with the ability to troubleshoot and assist and train others
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
* Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines
* Ability to function well in a high-paced and at times stressful environment
* Extremely proficient with Google Suite or similar software with the ability to learn new or updated software
* Ability to work independently
* Proven experience with automated testing tools such as Cypress.io, Selenium, JUnit, TestNG, Appium, etc.
* Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes
* Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development environment
* Solid understanding of the software development life cycle
* Ability to think critically and problem-solve with a keen eye for detail
* Strong communication and collaboration skills
* Familiarity with bug tracking tools like JIRA or Bugzilla
* Experience with performance and/or security testing
* Familiarity with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, Travis CI, CircleCI, etc.
* QA certification, such as ISTQB or CSTE


Preferred locations for remote employees are: Minnesota, Colorado, Illinois, South Carolina, Florida, Michigan, Georgia, Idaho or Maine.

**In alignment with our goal of continuing to create a diverse team, we are strongly encouraging candidates of color to apply.**

title: Test Engineer
description:
At Pegasys Medical, we're not just developing AI technology; we're enhancing the precision and safety of surgical operations with our cutting-edge solutions. As a Test Engineer, you will play an integral role in ensuring that our software meets the highest standards of quality. Your expertise will foster trust in our AI-driven applications, contributing to our mission of "Surgery. Simplified."
  
  

**Why you want to work for Pegasys’ Engineering team:**  

Our Engineering team is at the heart of our mission, and as a Test Engineer, you will be key to maintaining the integrity of our mobile and desktop applications as well as our backend services. Your commitment to quality will ensure that the data captured by our user-friendly interfaces or imported from other sources is reliable and accurate, directly influencing the performance of our AI algorithms and the success of our team.
  
  

The Test Engineer role at Pegasys involves creating and performing both manual and automated tests, ensuring comprehensive test coverage across our technology stack. You will be responsible for the continuous improvement of our testing processes and the delivery of flawless software and quality data to our users.
  
  

The ideal candidate for this role is meticulous, quality-driven, and passionate about delivering exceptional software within the healthcare space. If you are detail-oriented, enjoy working collaboratively, and are excited about playing a crucial part in advancing surgical practices through AI, Pegasys offers you the platform to make a significant impact.
  
  

This role is instrumental in our technology team and will report directly to the Head of Technology.
  
  

**How you'll make a difference:**  

Develop and implement detailed test plans and cases for both manual and automated testing to ensure high-quality software releases.
  
Work closely with product managers, designers, and developers to understand requirements and deliver comprehensive test coverage.
  
Utilize tools such as Jira, GitHub, Cypress, Flipper, Postman, and TestRail to design, execute, and manage tests efficiently.
  
Leverage cloud environments like AWS and Azure to test applications in real-world scenarios, ensuring performance and scalability.
  
Maintain and enhance existing test suites, and integrate them into continuous integration, continuous development workflows for ongoing quality assurance.
  
Identify, document, and track software defects, collaborating with the development team to facilitate timely resolutions.
  
Stay current with the latest testing methodologies and tools to continuously improve our testing strategies.
  
Participate in Agile development processes and contribute to the refinement of our testing practices.
  
  

**What you bring to the table:**  

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field, with a strong focus on software testing and quality assurance.
  
Experience in software testing, with a proven track record of creating and executing comprehensive test plans and cases.
  
Proficiency in utilizing test management tools and frameworks, such as Cypress for automated testing and TestRail for test case management.
  
Familiarity with issue tracking and project management tools like Jira and version control systems such as GitHub.
  
Experience with debugging tools like Flipper and API testing utilities such as Postman.
  
Understanding of cloud-based environments, with experience in AWS and Azure being highly desirable as well as Docker and Kubernetes.
  
Strong analytical skills, with an ability to troubleshoot complex software issues.
  
Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with a collaborative approach to problem-solving.
  
Knowledge of Agile methodologies and tools, with experience in a Scrum environment preferred.
  
  

**Please note:** at this time, visa sponsorship is not available.
  
  

Pegasys is dedicated to fostering an environment where growth, learning, and authenticity are valued. If you're ready to ensure the quality of software that's advancing the field of surgical AI, we welcome you to apply and join our remote-first team at Pegasys!

Fortive’s essential technology makes the world stronger, safer, and smarter. We accelerate transformation across a broad range of applications including environmental, health and safety compliance, industrial condition monitoring, next-generation product design, and healthcare safety solutions.
  
  

We are a global industrial technology innovator with a startup spirit. Our forward-looking companies lead the way in software-powered workflow solutions, data-driven intelligence, AI-powered automation, and other disruptive technologies. We’re a force for progress, working alongside our customers and partners to solve challenges on a global scale, from workplace safety in the most demanding conditions to groundbreaking sustainability solutions.
  
  

We are a diverse team 18,000 strong, united by a dynamic, inclusive culture and energized by limitless learning and growth. We use the proven Fortive Business System (FBS) to accelerate our positive impact.
  
  

At Fortive, we believe in you. We believe in your potential—your ability to learn, grow, and make a difference.
  
  

At Fortive, we believe in us. We believe in the power of people working together to solve problems no one could solve alone.
  
  

At Fortive, we believe in growth. We’re honest about what’s working and what isn’t, and we never stop improving and innovating.

title: Supplier Quality Engineer - Temporary
description:
Heron Therapeutics is a San Diego-based commercial-stage biotechnology company that is improving patient lives by developing cutting-edge medicine by applying our innovative science and technologies with well-known pharmacology. With therapeutic areas in oncology and pain, our goal is to offer alternatives so patients can be opioid-free post-surgery.



Our entrepreneurial culture gives everyone the chance to be heard and make an impact. We developed the Heron Ways of Working to implement practices that breathe life into our values and embed them into our daily experience, fostering open collaboration across teams, self-responsibility & accountability, and the mindset of always assuming positive intent!



If this sounds like a refreshing work environment, and you are ready to bring your best self to your career, we want to talk to you!


**For this position, we are open to remote work arrangements**



Estimated Pay range = $40-$50 per hour based on experience

  


**JOB DESCRIPTION:**



The Supplier Quality Engineer is focused on managing the evaluation and monitoring of contracted service suppliers to ensure products and services conform to Heron quality standard expectations. This position is responsible for ensuring compliance to Quality System Regulations, Quality policies, Quality Objectives, GMP/GCP/GLP/GVP, FDA, ISO and other regulations pertinent to Heron products as well as product quality and compliance objectives.



**ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Manage end to end performance of all GxP suppliers, including but not limited to: Quality Agreements, Auditing, Audit schedules, Approved Supplier List, Master Supplier Files, Supplier Qualification, Supplier Corrective Action Requests (SCAR), etc.
* Oversee the supplier audit program, as lead auditor or coordinator for audits, and work to mitigate major/critical findings.
* Managing performance of suppliers via best practices such as Scorecards to drive continuous improvement
* Support the supplier selection and qualification process
* Work with suppliers to establish control methods suitable to the nature of the product they supply.
* Build relationships with suppliers to ensure all levels of manufacturing understand the product requirements.
* Responsible for reporting of quality trends and information to management on the performance of supplier.
* Work with supplier to establish a structured approach for consistency and adherence to quality procedures and requirements.
* Other duties as assigned.


**REQUIREMENTS:**


* Bachelor of Science degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math (STEM), preferred and at least 3 years' experience with Supplier Quality in a manufacturing environment strongly preferred.
* Experienced working with Contract Manufacturers
* Certified ISO 13485 Lead Auditor, preferred
* Direct experience with Pharmaceuticals, APIs, and/or Medical Device industry, in a regulatory environment preferred
* Must have good communication skills.
* Candidate must be able to work autonomously and independently.
* Ability to influence others and build effective working relationships both internally and externally at various organizational levels.

  


*The above description is intended to describe the general nature of the job that may include other duties as assumed or assigned; it is not intended to be all inclusive or limit the duties of the position.*


*Heron is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer: Minority/Female/Disability/Veterans/Sexual Orientation and Gender Identity.*

title: Quality Assurance Analyst
description:
Despite our name, Bankjoy is not a bank! We are a silicon valley backed FinTech. Check out our investors Y Combinator and Bessemer Venture Partners and the impressive list of companies they have invested in! We are changing the way community banks and credit unions do business, enabling them to become tech-driven and digital first. Bankjoy provides modern digital banking products including mobile banking, online banking, online account opening, loan origination, and conversational AI. Our mission is to revolutionize banking tech infrastructure by leading digital transformation at financial institutions — big and small.

**This role pays $60k CAD.**

**The Role**


We are looking for a Quality Assurance Tester to drive world class quality in the software platform that makes a one of a kind experience for our customers. The successful candidate will be obsessed with quality improvement and automating tests for regression and new features.

**In this role, you will:**

* Develop, execute and maintain test cases in assigned functional areas.
* Identify and report bugs with accurate and detailed descriptions
* Communicate test results and status to stakeholders.
* Perform end-to-end solution & quarterly regression testing within technical capabilities.
* Work directly with the development team to ensure quick resolution and meet project timeline.
* Work independently and as part of a larger cross-functional QA team to ensure quality is maintained throughout all stages of the software development lifecycle
* Adhere to quality standards and following best practices.
* Participate in team agile practices such as attending stand-ups, backlog refinement, sprint planning, and team retrospectives.

**What you bring:**

* 4+ year of experience working as a Quality Assurance Tester
* 5+ years of industry experience in software development or test
* Experience in manual testing in a Fintech environment
* Knowledge of SQA methodology and tools
* Collaboration skills to work with product owners, tech leads and engineers.
* Strong knowledge of software testing methodologies, tools, and processes, such as Jira, Azure DevOps, DataDog, Sql Database, Postman, BrowserStack
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a track record of working effectively with development engineering and other functions
* Strong analytical skills, including ability to identify and solve ambiguous problems, and ability to analyze impacts of enhancement on existing function.
* Knowledge of automation tools and frameworks is a plus

**What you get:**

* A fast-paced and collaborative environment
* Competitive compensation
* Stock options at a well-funded startup
* 100% medical, dental and vision coverage for you. We cover family's at 50%. (US Employees & Canadian Employees)
* 401(k) plan with 4% company matching (US Employees)
* 4 weeks PTO and 5 health days
* 18 holidays
* Performance-based bonuses (US & Canadian Employees)
* Remote first culture

 **Equal Employment Opportunities at Bankjoy**


Bankjoy is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Bankjoy provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability.


Compensation Range: CA$60K

title: Quality Assurance Level 1
description:

Develop and execute software tests to identify software problems and their causes. Test system modifications to prepare for implementation. Document software and application defects using a bug tracking system and report defects to software or web developers. Create and maintain databases of known defects. May participate in software design reviews to provide input on functional requirements, operational characteristics, product designs, and schedules.

title: Quality Assurance Analyst
description:
**Open Position:** Quality Assurance Analyst

**Reports to:** Group Product Manager

**Location:** Remote

**About Us:**


HST Pathways is on a mission to transform healthcare with innovative software technology that enables surgery centers to provide more cost-efficient patient care and better outcomes. Our suite of solutions spans the entire case lifecycle, including scheduling, care coordination, clinical documentation, and revenue cycle. Backed by Bain Capital, we are the fastest growing ASC software company and serve over 1,100 surgery centers, but we’re just getting started and have plans to 10X the value we offer. However, our big ambitions are only as strong as the team behind them, which is why we’re looking to build our team with the best.

**What we’re looking for:**


You are inspiring, authentic, intuitive, highly motivated, results-driven, and a fast learner. You want to work for a company with a positive work culture that is fast-paced and evolving. You believe that working for a diverse and inclusive organization is best and hold the values of One Team, Inclusion, Transparency, Agility, Empathy, Growth Mindset and Proactivity - and you’re ready to be an ambassador that exemplifies these qualities. You are data driven and comfortable with a high-volume workload (“roll up your sleeves” approach) and adept at dealing with a dynamic work setting.

**Responsibilities:**

* Act as the primary technical resource to design, implement, execute, and maintain technical systems and infrastructure test cases based on design specifications within preproduction environments.
* Perform end-to-end QA processes for the technical and infrastructure systems that host HST applications, detailing interactions between the technical and infrastructure systems and HST applications.
* Identify and report bugs and deficiencies found through testing and document them with the appropriate product team.
* Create and maintain processes and procedures documentation for the technical and infrastructure systems QA process.
* Be a champion at HST in maintaining quality in every development lifecycle phase.

 **Qualifications:**

* 2+ years of experience in a software development testing environment. Experience as a QA analyst or relevant work experience in a software testing role.
* 2+ years of relevant work experience in EHR: use, QA, implementation, or training (Required). Expertise in healthcare or Electronic Health Record use and/or testing is critical to this role.
* Experience working with automated testing tools (ie. Leapwork)
* Skillset to trace and identify bugs and test gaps and affected systems.
* Excellent analytical, debugging, troubleshooting, and root cause analysis skills.
* Excellent people skills. You will be working with software development teams to ensure a quick resolution of bug fixes.
* Basic understanding of SQL.
* You must have a sense of humor and speak geek.
* Detail-oriented, punctual, and inquisitive.
* Passion and a deep understanding of best practices for Quality Engineering.

 **Perks & Benefits:**

* Remote work environment
* Health benefits paid for employee
* Flexible Paid Time Off Policy
* 11 company holidays per year
* Paid parental leave
* 401K with matching contributions
* Learning and development allowance
* A diverse, inclusive, and fun team!

**HST Pathways celebrates diversity and is steadfast in fostering an inclusive work environment where employees feel valued, respected, and engaged. We champion and nurture a culture where inclusiveness is instinctive and fuels innovation, connection, and a strong sense of “One Team”. HST is deeply committed to representing and reflecting the unique experiences, perspectives and viewpoints of our employees, customers, and the communities we serve.**

title: Test Engineer (E-commerce Platform)
description:
**Job Description:**

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Test Engineer to join our dynamic team responsible for testing our e-commerce platform ComAve (comave.com). As a Test Engineer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our platform by designing and executing comprehensive test plans, identifying and documenting defects, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software solutions to our customers.

**Responsibilities:**

1. Develop and execute test plans, test cases, and test scripts to verify the functionality, usability, and performance of our e-commerce platform.

2. Conduct manual and automated testing of web applications, APIs, and database integrations to identify defects and ensure compliance with functional requirements.

3. Collaborate with software developers, product managers, and business stakeholders to understand product requirements and translate them into test cases and acceptance criteria.

4. Participate in Agile development processes, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and sprint retrospectives, to provide input on testing strategies and priorities.

5. Perform regression testing to validate software changes and ensure backward compatibility with existing features and functionalities.

6. Document test results, defects, and issues in a clear and concise manner, and work with development teams to prioritize and resolve identified issues.

7. Continuously improve testing processes, methodologies, and tools to enhance efficiency, accuracy, and effectiveness of testing activities.

8. Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in software testing, quality assurance, and e-commerce technologies, and proactively apply this knowledge to drive improvements in our testing practices.

**Requirements:**

1. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.

2. 3+ years of proven experience as a Test Engineer or Quality Assurance Engineer in an e-commerce and web application development environment.

3. Solid understanding of software testing methodologies, test automation tools, and defect tracking systems.

4. Proficiency in writing and executing test cases, test scripts, and test scenarios for web applications, APIs, and database systems.

5. Experience with test automation frameworks and tools such as Selenium, Cypress, or similar.

6. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex issues and identify root causes.

7. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.

8. Self-motivated, proactive, and detail-oriented, with a strong commitment to delivering high-quality software solutions.

9. Familiarity with Agile development methodologies (Scrum, Kanban) and version control systems (Git) is a plus.

Job Type: Full-time

Experience level:

* 3 years

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Test automation: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Quality Engineer, SDET
description:
**JOB SUMMARY**


The Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer will design, develop, create, test, and execute automated test scripts. Responsible for Defining, applying & maintaining effective automation design standards and practices with the objectives of maximizing reusability and maintainability.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Design, develop, implement, and maintain automation frameworks and tools.
* Participate in the testing process through team collaboration, test case reviews and analysis to identify test automation or scripting concerns.
* Convert manual tests to automated tests ensuring quality through review of source code, creation of test data, manual testing, automated testing, debugging and inspection of test results.
* Execute test automation as part of release testing, record and analyze results and resolve test issues.
* Log defects for test failures due to changes in the code under test.
* Design, create and publish summarized reports of test results.
* Communicate testing events, daily statuses, test results, and metrics.

**ROLE QUALIFICATIONS**

**EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE**

**REQUIRED**

* BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field or equivalent industry related professional experience and education
* At least two (2) years of experience in designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining an automation framework
* At least two (2) years of experience in writing and creating automated tests and test scripts
* Proven success using open-source testing tools and projects (JUnit, NUnit, TestNG, etc.)
* Experience reporting automated test results in a clear, detailed, and analytical style using fact-based metrics
* Knowledge of test automation integration into CI/CD pipelines
* Experience with Selenium, C#, Java, GIT or any other source control tool
* Experience with Android, iPhone or Windows emulators and mobile device testing

**PREFERRED**

* Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills

**KEY COMPETENCIES**

  

* **Results-Oriented**: ability to plan, schedule and organize professional schedule to achieve strategic goals within or ahead of established time frames
* **Adaptability to Change**: ability to be flexible and supportive, react swiftly to and able to positively and proactively assimilate change in rapid growth environment
* **Interpersonal Communication**: ability to choose a communication behavior that is both appropriate and effective for a given situation; the ability to understand and manage your own emotions, as well as recognize and influence the emotions of others
* **Team Orientation and Collaboration:** ability to successfully build and maintain collaborative relationships to work effectively together as a team through shared responsibility, respect, and empathy to complete a shared goal for a common good
* **Accountability:** ability to act with a clear sense of ownership; takes personal responsibility for decisions, actions, deliverables, and failures; establishes clear responsibilities and processes for monitoring work and measuring results; embraces experimentation, creativity, and positive change

* **Cultural Competence**: ability to understand and respect values, attitudes, beliefs, and mores of the member that differ across cultures, and to consider and respond appropriately to these differences in planning, implementing, and evaluating health programs and interventions.

**WORKING CONDITIONS/EQUIPMENT USE**

* Work is performed indoors in a typical office environment - not substantially exposed to adverse environmental conditions.
* Must be able to lift up to fifteen (15) pounds
* Frequent use of office machines to include telephone, computer, and printer

title: Engineer, Quality Complaint Investigations
description:
**This is where you save and sustain lives**

At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You’ll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.


Baxter’s products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.


Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.


Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives— where your purpose accelerates our mission.

**Can be Fully Remote**

**Your role at Baxter**
-----------------------

**This is where your expertise helps people**
---------------------------------------------


You are a problem solver. Complex projects or unexpected challenges are just opportunities to bring your considerable abilities to use. Whether working independently or with a trusted team, you are always ready to tackle a project and work hard to find solutions.


Your talent is needed across a wide variety of industries. As an Engineer, you have a wide array of career choices, but are motivated by the opportunity to work in a company that supports innovation, professional development, and a purposeful mission.

**Your team**
-------------


We are a team of inquisitive individuals who embrace a collaborative environment to take on sophisticated challenges that meet the needs of our patients. We often need to change directions and respond to issues to avoid disruptions in our fast-paced manufacturing environment. Together, we build and maintain a positive work environment.


When you join us, you will work with a team of committed individuals who trust each other to deliver on the tasks at hand. We support innovation and out-of-the-box thinking balanced with collaboration across functions and other teams. Our leadership understands the need for continuous education and provides opportunities for further development.


As an Engineer, you will have the opportunity to lead by example, and enjoy mentoring and learning from others. Here, you are trusted to manage your own time and are given opportunities to grow your career as you wish.

**What you'll be doing**
------------------------

* This position has primary responsibility for investigation, review, and completion of all Quality Engineering complaint issue analysis tasks applying various quality system inputs!
* Review individual complaints and associated service data to determine risk level and complete investigation into the “as determined” problem code and cause codes for each complaint.
* Analyze data from various quality inputs (including but not limited to : Field Corrective Action (FCA), Complaints, FDA Medical Device Reports (MDR), etc.) to determine trends and systemic issues. Prepare and issue reports based on information analysis.
* Review existing investigation reports and identify gaps for GMP compliance. Develop strategies and plans to close the gaps in an efficient and technical manner.
* Develop and communicate expectations for quality performance, continuous improvement and process controls for marketed products.
* Observe and drive corrective action and continuous improvement activities that directly impact performance measures by performing primary investigations, conducting data analysis, and implementing corrective actions.
* Conduct or lead corrective and preventive actions in manufacturing using formal problem solving tools and documentation.
* Support CAPA and maintenance activities for existing product lines.
* Recommend and/or support projects for improvements to the quality system as approved by management.

**What you'll bring**
---------------------

* A Bachelors of Science in Engineering
* 1-3 years of Medical Device experience preferred
* Desired experience in the medical device industry in the areas of complaints, CAPA, sustaining engineering.
* Demonstrated strong analytical problem solving (Root Cause Investigations).
* Computer proficiency in Word, Excel, etc.
* Ability to multi-task and methodically handle projects.


We understand compensation is an important factor as you consider the next step in your career. At Baxter, we are committed to equitable pay for all employees, and we strive to be more transparent with our pay practices. The estimated base salary for this position is $68,000-$93,50 annually. The estimated range is meant to reflect an anticipated salary range for the position. We may pay more or less than of the anticipated range based upon market data and other factors, all of which are subject to change. Individual pay is based on upon location, skills and expertise, experience, and other relevant factors. For questions about this, our pay philosophy, and available benefits, please speak to the recruiter if you decide to apply and are selected for an interview.


The successful candidate for this job may be required to verify that he or she has been vaccinated against COVID-19, subject to reasonable accommodations for individuals with medical conditions or religious beliefs that prevent vaccination, and in accordance with applicable law.

**Equal Employment Opportunity**


Baxter is an equal opportunity employer. Baxter evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.  

  

EEO is the Law  

EEO is the law - Poster Supplement  

Pay Transparency Policy

**Reasonable Accommodations**  

  

Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

Baxter has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Baxter employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. title: Software Tester/Quality Assurance
description:

**Responsibilities Include:**  

* Act as a system tester, including applying expertise in analytical work to a complex, custom coded Web-based software application.
* Deliver expertise in a variety of software QA concepts, practices, and procedures
* Conduct manual functional, regression, and system integration testing, support user acceptance testing, and report issues found during the test life cycle
* Create test cases that verify approved requirements for assigned modules and document results
* Assist with software application troubleshooting and technical diagnosis and support the continuous improvement of the current test process.
* Collaborate closely with other team members and departments.

**Qualifications:**

* Secret Clearance
* Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
